scenario:
Wall Street's Q4 earnings season begins next week with notable names such as JPMorgan Chase, Wells Fargo, Citigroup, BlackRock, Bank of America, Goldman Sachs, Morgan Stanley, UnitedHealth, and Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing reporting their financial results. The earnings season gathers momentum in the final week of January when mega-cap tech companies, including Microsoft, Alphabet, Tesla, Meta Platforms, Amazon, and Apple, release their quarterly updates.

Analysts expect annualized profit growth of +11.9% and an increase of +4.6% in revenue growth. The Financial sector is expected to report the largest annualized earnings growth rate of all eleven sectors, at +39.5%, while the Information Technology sector is forecast to report the second-highest annualized earnings growth rate, at +20.7%. The Energy sector is expected to report the worst drop of any sector, with earnings tumbling -24.6% compared to last year.

In terms of revenue expectations, analysts have decreased their estimates during the quarter, with the S&P 500 expected to report annualized sales growth of +4.6%, compared to expectations for revenue growth of +5.2% at the end of September. Eight sectors are projected to report year-over-year growth in revenues, led by the Information Technology and Utilities sectors, at +11.1% and +8.0%, respectively.

Using the InvestingPro Stock Screener, 38 stocks were identified that are forecast to deliver growth of more than 25% in both earnings per share and revenue. Notable tech-related names include Astera Labs, Nvidia, Coinbase, Super Micro Computer, Reddit, Robinhood, Seagate, Western Digital, AppLovin, Trade Desk, DraftKings, CrowdStrike, Cloudflare, Snowflake, and Palantir. Other stocks to watch include Eli Lilly, Newmont, Jeffries Financial, Blackstone, Prudential Financial, Affirm, Axon Enterprise, Comfort Systems, Toast, and On Holding.

The S&P 500 is expected to report its highest year-over-year earnings growth rate in three years, dating back to Q4 2021. The sector is expected to report the largest annualized earnings growth rate of all eleven sectors, at +39.5%. The Information Technology sector is forecast to report the second-highest annualized earnings growth rate, at +20.7%. The Energy sector is expected to report the worst drop of any sector, with earnings tumbling -24.6% compared to last year.
